page.title: 06DANCING IN THE EIGHTIES
page.content: AT A DISCO there is a man called a Disc-Jockey who plays records of popular music.At DISCOS there are flashing lights of many colours.Although we just call them 'Flashing Lights' they are really called 'Disco Lights'.There are many differents kinds; some made to flash onto the walls and ceilings of the hall where the Disco is being held. The D.J.plays the records very loudly.The boys do 'break-dancing' or 'body-popping'.Here are some of the things they do: Head-spins,Windmill, Caterpillar, Turtle,Back Flips,Popping, Hand-spin, Knee-spin,and Swallow-dive. We have lots of good records by popular groups such as Style Council, Tears for Fears,Wham!,Frankie Goes To Hollywood etc.
